v.v: A declaration about the desert by the sea.
A distressing vision has been given to me:
Therefore my loins are filled with pain;
My heart pounds; I shake with fear.
They prepare the table, they spread rugs and eat and drink;
For this is what the Lord said to me,
When he sees a chariot, a pair of horsemen,
Here comes a chariot with a man and a pair of horsemen.
My threshed and winnowed ones, children of my threshing floor!

v: Like stormwinds sweeping through the Negev it comes
passing through from the wilderness, from a terrible land.
the treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys.
Go up and attack, Elam; besiege, Media;
I will stop all her groaning.
pains like the pains of a woman in labor have taken hold of me;
I am bowed down by what I heard; I am disturbed by what I saw.
Twilight was my desire, but it brought me terror.
arise, princes, anoint your shields with oil.
“Go, post a watchman; he must report what he sees.
riders on donkeys, and riders on camels,
then he must pay attention and be very alert.”
“Lord, on the watchtower I stand all day, every day,
and at my post I stand all night long.”
He calls out, “Babylon has fallen, fallen,
and all the carved figures of its gods are broken to the ground.”
What I have heard from Yahweh of hosts,
the God of Israel, I have declared to you.

v.v: The watchman said, “The morning comes and also the night.

v: One calls to me from Seir,
“Watchman, what is left of the night?
Watchman, what is left of the night?”
If you want to ask, then ask; and come back again.”

v.v: For they have fled from the sword, from the drawn sword,
For this is what the Lord said to me, “Within a year, as a laborer hired for a year would see it, all the glory of Kedar will end.
Only a few of the archers, the warriors of Kedar will remain,” for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken.

v: In the wilderness of Arabia you spend the night, you caravans of Dedanites.
inhabitants of the land of Tema, meet the fugitives with bread.
from the bent bow, and from the weight of war.
